arts.ttl: Lee Buchanan reveals physio prediction and Birmingham City meetings which inspired comeback
arts.sum: At least one of Blues’ full-backs is usually given freedom to get forward by Davies and Buchanan will need to contribute to keep out Alex Cochrane when the other left-back returns from his own injury. Lee Buchanan has found himself in that position, 20 yards from goal after a corner is cleared, many times in his Birmingham City career.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City player gets dressing room round of applause from teammates and Chris Davies
arts.sum: Blues boss Davies said: “Lee has had a lot of setbacks through injury in the last few months but what I’ve noticed in the times that he’s played is that he’s taken on the information I’ve given him very well. Birmingham City’s players gave Lee Buchanan a round of applause in the dressing room after he marked his first league outing in seven months with his first goal for the club.

arts.ttl: Birmingham march on with another victory
arts.sum: Bristol Rovers offered little in response.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies says Birmingham City have a new ‘real leader’ and outlines Rangers transfer stance
arts.sum: “He’s not the loudest guy in the room but he’s one of those who, when he speaks, people listen,” Chris Davies told BirminghamLive. Chris Davies has been so keen to shoehorn his namesake into his line-up that Blues captain Bielik has been shifted to right-back in recent weeks.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City offer ‘on the way’ – Player ‘about to move’ to England, can double salary with Blues
arts.sum: Birmingham City were keen on signing Phil Neumann in the summer window and made an offer, which was rejected by Hannover 96. The League One side are still showing interest in the 27-year-old. That’s according to Bild, who provide the latest on the Blues transfer pursuit. Neumann was disappointed with the second division German club’s The post Birmingham City offer ‘on the way’ – Player ‘about to move’ to England, can double salary with Blues appeared first on Sport Witness.

arts.ttl: What every League One boss has said about Birmingham City so far
arts.sum: Birmingham City have been the talk of League One for much of this season and Chris Davies will want his team to assert their authority over the busy Christmas period. Evans dubbed Blues 'the Galacticos of League One' and 'Real Birmingham' in the week leading up to the match at the New York Stadium, but he focussed less on their finances after watching his team get pulled apart on the pitch.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies gives Willum Willumsson fitness update before Birmingham City play Bristol Rovers
arts.sum: Willum Willumsson has been given a clean bill of health and could come into contention for Birmingham City’s meeting with Bristol Rovers on Saturday. Willumsson has recovered and could reclaim his spot in Blues’ line-up against Rovers, but Dykes might not be ready.

arts.ttl: Wayne Rooney reveals ‘honest conversations’ as Plymouth boss looks to avoid Birmingham City repeat
arts.sum: With Plymouth one point above bottom-of-the-table Hull City – who have recent changed managers to appoint Ruben Selles – and possessing comfortably the worst goal difference in the Championship, Rooney is under pressure to turn results around. "That's a responsibility on individuals, a responsibility on players covering their team-mates, and these are all discussions we are having to try to improve that and make it better, and stop conceding the goals we are conceding because we are killing ourselves.”

arts.ttl: George Friend shares heart-warming Jay Stansfield story and his Birmingham City regret
arts.sum: Blues fans do indeed love a player who would have first come to their attention in August 2021 when as an 18-year-old he was part of a Fulham team that came to St Andrew’s and defeated Lee Bowyer's men 2-0 in the early rounds of the League Cup. Friend first encountered the Blues striker when he was playing with his father Adam at Exeter City.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City transfer fears allayed as former Blues man finally lands new club
arts.sum: "I believe the project is set in the huge ambitions Birmingham City have so the players will be on board with that and look to finish the job they started by getting promotion to the Championship. Former Birmingham City captain Stephen Carr isn’t concerned about Blues losing any of their best players in the upcoming January transfer window.
